thread.title: Is there soot in Pittsburgh?
thread.title_full: Is there soot in Pittsburgh? - The Washington Post

author: washingtonpost.com
title: Is there soot in Pittsburgh?
text:
October 9 at 7:43 PM In the July 19 Travel article “ The smartest route to Pittsburgh: No shortcuts ,” Joel Achenbach wrote about Pittsburgh, “I’ve never seen it look anything but clean and fresh. Where are smokestacks belching stygian clouds of toxic fumes? Why is there no soot raining from the sky? I guess that image of Pittsburgh is off by a century or two.”
But the Sept. 29 front-page article “ Foes of EPA pollution rules enlist minorities ,” said, “For years, the air over central Pittsburgh has ranked among the country’s dirtiest, with haze and soot that regularly trigger spikes in asthma attacks.  . . . ” What changed in Pittsburgh that there is now soot raining from the sky?
Bob Schoenike , Warrenton
